intro: Lotus erythrorhizus, commonly known as the red-rooted lotus, is a perennial aquatic plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking red roots and heart-shaped leaves that float on the water surface. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, adding ornamental value to wetland environments. It thrives in shallow freshwater habitats and is often found in ponds and marshes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and wetland restoration projects.
